main event: A bright white light was observed over Silver Bay, Minnesota for about 20 minutes on November 23, 1960.
interesting points: The observer described the light as circular and four times the size of a star., The observation was made by a reliable witness, the superintendent of a machine shop., Weather conditions were clear at the time of observation., The object was noted to have moved toward the western horizon after its initial appearance., Investigators concluded that the object was probably Venus based on the timing and location.
sighted object: a bright white light in the sky
witness description: superintendent of machine shop of the Mining Reserve Company
